item.title: Understanding performance with Google Benchmark @ Italian C++ Meetup
item.description: During the last meetup of the Italian C++ Community in Modena, Italy I had the chance to give a talk about profiling C++ code. The whole game boils down to understanding what’s going on when you have to cope with very smart optimizing compilers, NUMA architectures and speculative, superscalar CPUs: in this quest for knowledge we are lucky enough to have some extremely useful tools like the holy perf and micro benchmarks, using the excellent Google Benchmark for instance.
